intro: Trimezia brevicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trimezia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
